article.headline: W. Kentucky 98, Saint Joseph's 70
article.story: PHILADELPHIA -- Sergio Kerush -- the Preseason Player of the Year in the Sun Belt Conference -- scored a game-high 31 points on 11 of 15 shooting to lead Western Kentucky past St. Joseph's 98-70 on Friday night in the season opener for both teams. Kerush also grabbed nine rebounds and shot 6 of 8 from three-point range. The Hilltoppers shot 51.4 percent in the first half as they amassed a 48-38 halftime lead. Western Kentucky's hot shooting continued in the second half as the Hilltoppers hit 21 of 29 attempts (72.4 percent) and outscored the Hawks 50-32. Juan Pattillo and Steffphon Pettigrew each scored 17 points for Western Kentucky and Pattillo had 12 rebounds to complete the double-double. Carl Jones scored 17 points for St. Joseph's in the loss. The loss snapped a five-game winning streak in season-opening games for the Hawks.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
